body_html: Plus for a truly distributed case, as TCP connection is stream oriented, it would involve a fair amount of locking if you’d perform multithreading with the same socket and effectively make its performance equivalent to the single-thread case at best. If we restrict it to the intranode case, why not just use immutable shared memory? You could avoid bulk memcpy all together.
